document.title: Wisconsin's Model Academic Standards for Personal Financial Literacy

455AC7B058164DA1B234843685DDBFB8.description: Describe the importance of protecting personal assets against financial loss (e.g., as applied to a classroom financial project).

3B2C23E0184049F4922F1B963C5E24F8.description: Identify the opportunity-cost associated with selected financial decisions.

2646CF45D8654798A5C8CDBFD1E436D1.description: Integrate and apply concepts related to personal financial risk, protection from loss, and financial planning.

F68D3BBD60734496834BD4C5427190C6.description: List potential consequences of being over- or under-insured.

7A850EB9E10749B2AF55C6D99555194F.description: Explain the basic premise behind insurance.

68C1576386B24C86BBFC8E50DB99A7DD.description: Examine the need for and value of various types of insurance (such as health, property, life, disability, and liability) within the life cycle.

C626D87159E14F52ADDF1C2C1C01E17F.description: Recognize the importance of protection against financial loss.

EA16CE3036B846EEBA136A6678D351C5.description: Identify different forms of financial risk.

075818C9587A45E98F5477F28D93A117.description: Understand the nature of personal financial risk and the importance of protecting against financial loss.

37FF27FA821C4240B80EA391FEF3AD7B.description: Students in Wisconsin will understand the features and role of insurance in financial planning and be able to analyze and balance risk against benefits in financial planning.

BBCD18529B6C4754BA5888DF9C555AC9.description: Understand the role of philanthropy, volunteer service, and charities in community development and quality of life.

F885DE6BE04546D8A3B28B243A4D37CC.description: Define the importance and impact of business, government, and consumer fiscal responsibility.

403CC5C896A04AA48439E9D98DC65025.description: Summarize the consequences of consumer-citizen decisions and actions on the economy, broader society, and the environment.

89A4FC72AE55450AB9ABC6C94410DF00.description: Relate the impact of global economic events to personal financial planning.

16BBA8B40563442DB3A3F73DEDA47880.description: Examine the impact that government, business, consumer, and financial decisions and actions have on the individual, family, community, society, and world.

FB7111F47CAB4B2CBBE6CD5D6B10DC20.description: Understand the concept of financial obligations.

4181E0C31CEA42C9AFCE9C3CEBB4400A.description: Identify how citizen decisions and actions can influence the use of economic resources to achieve basic societal and individual services.

B2C86A5C350641F2854A2406894CCC45.description: Describe ways the economic system of production and consumption is a means to achieve other important societal goals.

68AD5667A5984B70B6D204B703EB9F48.description: Compare interrelationships between the management of personal financial resources, the economic system, and important social values.

952CFFFB1C8142E09F1B0C4A3AAAA145.description: Understand the concept and forms of taxation and its role in public activities/initiatives.

CBE8EA0FD95942068065C78A88D7F94A.description: Understand the interdependent role of government, business, consumer, and personal finance in the economy.

7262107684434CDEBE997B99889B941F.description: List options for informed and responsible action to address significant personal financial literacy questions/issues.

E3036B91660442098F5F2B34F81D564A.description: List public policy issues of concern to citizens (as family members, workers, community members, and citizens).

0DCB722DD66A4D92A2262DC6D4E52504.description: Integrate and apply financial knowledge, attitudes, and skills.

D802DCAB8B8A45449056AAF55D127242.description: Identify processes for responsible financial planning and decision making.

4B7C0A41FE9B414397FC7B716BB115DA.description: Practice skills related to fiscal responsibility and personal decision making.

59CAE21DF9E74C2CB21FCCC1F939AD87.description: Recognize attitudes, assumptions, and patterns of behavior regarding money, saving, investing, and work.

106E77A1788944249DE2F041964291C6.description: Describe individual, social, and cultural differences in the understanding and use of money and other financial resources.

E29782AD4C644C4CA457A6888A7A23B7.description: Understand factors that affect citizen financial decisions and actions.

B64A3048E40545BCAA8A85C38BFECE28.description: Students in Wisconsin will understand the personal and social impact of their own financial decisions within the family, the local community, and the global community, as well as understand the ethical and legal issues related to income, profit, and personal wealth.

013A4F48C7934DC9B69D0CAA0209A5EC.description: Identify elements of being a responsible consumer.

76D36F21C72A4F27B057F869D8E102EC.description: Identify the benefits and costs of buying goods.

84E233DB2E73429BB15FC738B3CD32B3.description: Examine critically the impact of socio-cultural norms and demographics related to money, saving, and spending.

AF78489303984471B87A2A2E2D131F80.description: Recognize resources that can be used to make consumer decisions.

A65E5C46BE8745F79E2C448EF3321347.description: Describe fraud and the location of legal language regarding fraud.

3EC8858409714A35BB1058D12B8CE43D.description: Identify sources of consumer protection and assistance including public institutions and private organizations (professionals, publications, and internet).

D3648DB1A3B1464C88296F8CA16D5B81.description: Understand that verbal contracts are as binding as written agreements.

7273E8E565114A358070D5BCB1D0ABF1.description: Identify interest rates and fees associated with financial services.

D2AED4338FB041E8A675B07AF4A5B911.description: Understand the cost of interest rates and fees associated with financial services.

B658F255D0524C34AB7730F5E0BC84B6.description: Identify business practices that affect the consumer.

FBEB83B85E2E4D4B9D5754E57B8180EA.description: Recognize techniques and effects of deceptive advertising.

F8F67A4EFF8A4FB3978D092A4325E594.description: Investigate the purposes, strategies, and effects of various business practices, including sales schemes or scams.

8FFD1A6577C34ABDB431415C1B8DE5F9.description: Identify factors to consider when making one's own consumer decisions.

6284EA6E1968489CA0825118E5D02ED9.description: Understand the impact of contextual factors associated with consumer decision making. (e.g., social, historical, political, family, cultural, philosophical).

D1621ADF577C4B61A6CB197894AD1DFE.description: Students in Wisconsin will know and use available consumer resources and make responsible choices by applying economic principles in their consumer decisions.

17B62BE4DD164FEA973DE12A5C1C9693.description: Demonstrate ability to use decision-making processes in making financial decisions related to planning, saving, and investing.

BB6694A1DF614696AAC7FA43176759A6.description: Describe the relationships between saving and investing

37B6CB1098C2495F9DFD2F3B3CF4298F.description: Match appropriate financial services and products with specified goals.

36DCB06D062E42E3974C6E41D2E9632D.description: Apply strategies for creating wealth/building assets.

A7D0B2C0204E4100B65BB63DFAC79B60.description: Students in Wisconsin will understand the value, features, and planning processes associated with saving and investing, and be able to apply this knowledge to long-term financial security and wealth.

4502C1617CED4F37B36FC16C970F578B.description: Discuss personal responsibilities related to borrowing.

1E27CED6CF2F4E43B06679BBB81E4C8E.description: Understand the relationship between income and expenses.

4402EC48B10C4C95A8A66A3E98C6061F.description: Understand the concept of a credit card and a debit card.

07647BDF1CAF4484B96F385AB035DDD6.description: Identify and evaluate interest rates, fees, and other charges.

4BCB3AA9BD9A4706BFDF98405E76C3EB.description: Describe the difference between credit and debt.

72AB18A565054D0682932D45AD94555D.description: Identify and compare sources of credit.

618FB5B6283D488B86A3D22856DF619D.description: Describe the concept of a loan.

2B47D2BA3D2B479C83F638B8F582C30E.description: Explain the difference between products and services.

53C76F2D719746CBA45E999EFCECF081.description: Identify and evaluate credit products and services.

C94C9AA7286A40ABBFEAF7950F510B14.description: Students in Wisconsin will make informed decisions about incurring debt and will manage indebtedness to remain both creditworthy and financially secure.

B3B30B8B1FAD44B094BB4278AE97BF4F.description: Explain how taxes are collected and used.

04DA6EAF8E774F4EB6895C0E670D34A0.description: Understand the history, purposes, roles, and responsibilities related to taxation.

438728CDBB514BBD987E56304B269811.description: Identify ways to earn and save for a future event.

043D6C6684894C9D893CB374D53A9CF7.description: Develop a financial vision based on an examination of personal values.

B02365AAAEEF4FBA899B76F2DB05C78F.description: Understand the difference between cash, check, credit card, and debit card.

9EF28BFCEA26491E831F06BFE8C2C502.description: Identify the purposes of financial institutions in the community.

0C7CB72361F849899593B739D4372F5C.description: Understand the purposes and services of financial institutions.

2B29674B0BE245099E24328881432E05.description: Define a budget and its importance.

5C8B282A70934F48BBC282BBACA02517.description: Identify the consequences of various financial decisions related to spending and saving.

9348A4B05F354B20A767C221C87993FF.description: Demonstrate ability to use money management skills and strategies.

AAC35C306ED04738837984B08E602A86.description: Students in Wisconsin will manage money effectively by understanding and developing financial goals and budgets.

FEC66B03623A4AA095B4D3068D463D45.description: Explain the meaning and purposes of taxes.

15066B6E789440F4A471E365D8F3E263.description: Explain how taxes and employee benefits relate to disposable income.

9584BAC35C3549289FCA0AF90B7CFC0F.description: Determine how personal interest and talents can affect career choice.

52A74E148B884BE8ADF2A4FD58BFAC54.description: Explain how income affects lifestyle choices and spending decisions.

902EE58D050A4AA78F1AE0E72B41608E.description: Understand the sources of income and alternative resources.

DED71DA8F99E4D4086E62F75E74C8FE1.description: Recognize the difference between a job and a career.

45ED04735D5744AC9D02EDB07DA06FA0.description: Be aware of how career choices, education choices, and skills affect income.

6FAA1FBEE7C046288CD0EA5018447E60.description: Understand how career choice, education, skills, entrepreneurship, and economic conditions affect income.

4E144064B4294FFD867A83F4F4D10D91.description: Students in Wisconsin will understand the relationship between education, income, career, and desired lifestyle and will develop the planning skills needed to achieve desired financial goals.
